Description: Two bands of tapestry applied and sewn to an undyed, linen, plain weave textile; the edges of the plain weave have been hemmed indicating this used to be the edge of the sleeve of a tunic; except for a few red wool threads, all the wool weft is now missing so that the decoration is hard to decipher; the larger band at the top shows at the centre, a medallion which depicted the bust of a human figure with a possible halo, on each side two quadrupeds are visible, the upper and lower part of this band is bordered with a freize of beige waves on a red background; the lower band of tapestry was probably decorated with stylised vegetal motifs; balanced plain weave: warp-undyed linen (S/12), weft-undyed linen (S/12); 3 edges of the plain weave are hemmed and sewn, the 4th is cut; larger/top tapestry on grouped threads: warp-undyed linen (S spun Z ply/11), weft-undyed linen (S/480, red wool (S) other wool missing; bottom tapestry on grouped threads: warp-undyed linen (S spun Z ply/9), weft - undyed linen (S/32), wool missing; oversewing threads in undyed line (S spun Z ply)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
